name: 論文寫作
description: This course will provide practical experience and the professional/scholarly knowledge and skills to aid students in preparing thesis, dissertations, articles, papers and/or other manuscripts/products for refereed dissemination.  Techniques and knowledge will be gained in how to serve as a paper or journal article referee, paper discussant and/or chair of a “paper presentation session” will be illuminated.  Quantitative research will be the focus of the course.
goals: Describe the major content areas that should be present in a thesis or dissertation, and for a paper, or article submitted for publication.
Identify the essential components that should be observed when critiquing/refereeing a research article or paper.
Identify sources of assistance on the preparation of professional articles/papers.
Describe how to present a professional paper.
Describe how to chair a professional paper presentation session.
Describe how to discuss a paper at a professional paper session.
Understanding the nature of scholarship and its dissemination.
Understand how to prepare research proposals for a thesis, dissertation, or for funding.
Understand how to consume research (critiquing methods employed).
10.　Teach students how to serve as a referee, discussant or judge.

methodologies.note: Text book, PowerPoint slides and video clips will be used to introduce the topics relevant to thesis writing
Students will collaborate to discuss how to choose appropriate research methods for various research topics, how to interpret and report the result of analyzed data.
Students will practice writing a thesis proposal

grading.note: Students will be assigned a number of assignments for developing the final thesis proposal
A final exam will be given to test students comprehension level on the concepts learned from this course
Students are expected to attend each class, prepare discussed readings and assignments and actively participate in class discussions.
Class attendance is required. Please come to the class on time and notify the instructor ahead of time if you will be late or absent for a class.
